skill.name: file-organizer
skill.description: Intelligently organizes your files and folders across your computer by understanding context, finding duplicates, suggesting better structures, and automating cleanup tasks. Reduces cognitive load and keeps your digital workspace tidy without manual effort.
skill.summary: Intelligently organizes your files and folders across your computer by understanding context, findin...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based skill containing only natural language instructions for the AI. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or direct filesystem access patterns are present. The skill relies on the AI's built-in tools and requires explicit user consent before any file operations.

content.value_statement: Disorganized files create stress and waste time searching. This skill analyzes your folder structure, finds duplicates, and organizes files with your approval. It handles the mental load of organization so you can focus on your work.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes folder structures and provides organization recommendations
Finds duplicate files using hash comparison
Creates logical folder hierarchies based on file types and content
Organizes files by date, type, or purpose with user approval
Suggests archive strategies for old or inactive files
Provides maintenance tips to prevent future clutter
limitations: Requires user confirmation before any file moves or deletions
Works only within directories the AI can access
Cannot recover files after deletion without backup

use_cases.title: Tidy messy Downloads folders
use_cases.description: Sort hundreds of downloaded files into organized categories like Work, Personal, Photos, and Installers.

use_cases.title: Structure project directories
use_cases.description: Review and reorganize project folders, separating active work from archived projects with consistent naming.

use_cases.title: Find and remove duplicate files
use_cases.description: Locate duplicate documents across folders, compare versions, and free up storage space.

prompt_templates.title: Quick downloads cleanup
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me organize my Downloads folder. Move documents to Documents, images to Pictures, and archive anything older than 3 months.

prompt_templates.title: Duplicate finder
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all duplicate files in my Documents folder. Show me each duplicate set with file paths and sizes so I can decide which to keep.

prompt_templates.title: Project restructuring
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my ~/Projects directory. Analyze the current structure, identify issues like mixed active/archived projects, and propose a better organization system.

prompt_templates.title: Photo by date
prompt_templates.prompt: Organize all photos in my Pictures folder by year and month based on modification dates. Create a folder structure like 2024/01-January.

output_examples.input: Help me organize my Downloads folder
output: Found 247 files across 5 subfolders (1.2 GB total)
File types: 89 images, 62 PDFs, 45 installers, 32 documents, 19 archives
Proposed structure: Work/, Personal/, Installers/, Archive/, ToSort/
Will move 180 files to organized folders and flag 67 items for your review

best_practices: Start with one folder like Downloads to build confidence before tackling larger areas
Always review the organization plan before giving approval to make changes
Archive old files instead of deleting them when unsure about keeping them
anti_patterns: Granting blanket permission without reviewing the proposed changes first
Using the skill on folders containing active project work without backup
Ignoring the skill's recommendations about files that need your decision

faq.question: What directories can this skill access?
faq.answer: The skill can access any directory the AI assistant can access on your system, including your home folder, Documents, Downloads, and Projects.

faq.question: Does the skill delete files without asking?
faq.answer: No. The skill explicitly requires your confirmation before any deletion or permanent action. It always asks first.

faq.question: Can it recover files after organization?
faq.answer: The skill does not have built-in recovery. Always ensure you have a backup of important files before major reorganization.

faq.question: What file types can it organize?
faq.answer: It handles all file types including documents, images, videos, archives, code files, and spreadsheets. It uses file extensions and content to categorize.

faq.question: How does it find duplicates?
faq.answer: It uses hash-based comparison to find exact duplicates and can identify similarly named files for your review.

faq.question: Can I undo changes after organization?
faq.answer: The skill logs all moves it makes. If needed, you can use those logs to restore original file positions manually.
